from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# Initialize Spark session
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("ReadFromSynapse") \
    .getOrCreate()

# JDBC connection details
server_name = "azdevsynapse.sql.azuresynapse.net"
database_name = "DSQLdb"
table_name = "dbo.Person"
username = "sqladminuser"
password = "Hellopassword#"
jdbc_url = f"jdbc:sqlserver://{server_name}:1433;database={database_name};encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=false;hostNameInCertificate=*.sql.azuresynapse.net;loginTimeout=30;"


# Read data from Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool
df = spark.read.format("jdbc").option("url", jdbc_url).option("dbtable", table_name).option("user", username).option("password", password).option("driver", "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver").load()

# Show the data
df.show()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, IntegerType, StringType

spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("DefineSchemaExample") \
    .getOrCreate()

schema = StructType([
    StructField("id", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("first_name", StringType(), True),  # Equivalent to varchar(40)
    StructField("last_name", StringType(), True)    # Equivalent to varchar(40)
])

data = [
    (1, "Alice", "Jordan"),
    (2, "Bob", "Finn"),
    (3, "Catherine", "Fay")
]

# Create the DataFrame with the defined schema
df = spark.createDataFrame(data, schema=schema)

# JDBC connection details
server_name = "azdevsynapse.sql.azuresynapse.net"
database_name = "DSQLdb"
table_name = "dbo.Person"
username = "sqladminuser"
password = "Hellopassword#"
jdbc_url = f"jdbc:sqlserver://{server_name}:1433;database={database_name};encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=false;hostNameInCertificate=*.sql.azuresynapse.net;loginTimeout=30;"

# Write DataFrame to Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool
df.write.format("jdbc").option("url", jdbc_url).option("dbtable", table_name).option("user", username).option("password", password).option("driver", "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver").mode("append").save()
